intro: Vincetoxicum discolor, commonly known as the red bittersweet, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that turn bright red in the fall. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in early summer, which are followed by orange-red berries. Vincetoxicum discolor is part of the loganiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. However, it is considered invasive in some regions due to its rapid spread and ability to outcompete native vegetation.
